fields.description: For beating one of the oldest standing WRs, Sosis' 1:34.397 on rDH Non-SC, by a frame
For being the first German to sub 1:48 on DDR and getting to 7th EU with it. Honorable mention to the fact that he also took care of the Online TT Lounge Season 2 launch that week
For getting his first WRs on RR Glitch after a grind from a 2:06 to a 1:56, beating Justin
For reclaiming his BC WR from Fox with a 2:08.697

For making the rMC Glitch and beating the 3lap WR with it for the first time in History

For achieving the long-awaited sub 20 on MG Glitch, he also got 100$ from Phyz by winning his bounty for beating Bryce
For his 11th WW time of 1:49.101 on rWS No-Glitch, starting his breakthrough from his first sub 1:50 and preceding his 1:48.978 set 2 weeks later, his first WW Top time
For climbing up to the Combined podium (#3) for the first time in his amazing career. He took out Braixen for it.
For getting the first 1:44 on DK Summit. His dedication to it for so many years has finally paid off.
For getting the long-awaited sub 1:50 on WGM Non-SC with a 1:49.965
He literally shut Logan's mouth by stopping his WR-farming on KC, with the first ever sub 2 on the track. An insane 1:59.751 beating Logan by 8 seconds.
For pulling through and getting his first ever WW Top time, a 1:18.403 on rSGB Glitch
For getting his first WR on KC Glitch with a 2:10.809
For getting yet another Glitch Flap WR, subbing 3 on GV with a 2.881
For getting the most unexpected run for everyone (including himself) on MC, with a 1:21.440 that granted him WW Tops by a single millisecond
For entering the Unrestricted AF Top 10 for the first time in his career, kicking out French Legend Thomas Petraud that had been on this Top 10 for years
For reclaiming his long lost Daisy Circuit crown, on Flap with a new WR of  28.110
For getting his first Kart WR, on KC with a 2:21.637 beating one of Ivan's best runs
For shooting his shot on the recent CM Glitch Flap discovery and taking the #1 spot there with a time of 4.158
For getting his first WW Top on MC No-Glitch with a time of 1:21.372
For getting his 2nd ever WR and becoming a multi-WR holder for the first time with a 2:08.951 on BC Shortcut, being the first person to sub 2:09 on this category
For getting his first Country Tops, on MT Glitch with a 2:05.314. Using the wheel, he also got the 7th Wheel time when he didn't even think he could achieve that feat in the first place.
For getting yet another WR on MT No-Glitch, beating the previous one by almost a full second and going from a 2:14.0 to a 2:13.1, Demon almost skipped 2:13 entirely
For getting his 2nd ever WR, a crazy 1:14.513 on rSGB Glitch, beating Luke's previous WR by over a second
For heavily grinding CM Glitch and finishing with a time of 33.142, ranked 9th American as his first Continental Tops
For reclaiming his Flap WR from Logan on GCN Mario Circuit after more than 200 days
For discovering a new, 3lap viable way of glitching Shy Guy Beach, and introducing it to the community in the best possible way
For getting his 1st (and 2nd!) WR, on rSL Glitch, after weeks of grinding for a 2/3 run
For being the first Karter to have 3 of his WRs last 1000+ days, with his CM Glitch, and casually beating it by .1 in like a week
For cutting an insane amount of AF this week and climbing deep into Top 250 when he wasn't even seeing himself getting to that level almost ever
For being the 3rd person to successfully land the Rainbow Road Glitch in a run and getting 3rd WW with that
For remembering his old ways, getting one last farewell WR on rSGB after more than 3 years without setting one
For overtaking Totom in Blue AF to reach a carrer high of #9, leaving the frenchie on the edge of losing the top for the first time in around 10 years
For getting a 1:47 on DKS... That's a Wii Wheel WR, the first sub 1:48 with the controller and his first American Top on top of that
For improving on a bunch of 3laps to enter the Top 10 in No-SC Total Time
For pulling off the rWS glitch 2/3 for the first time in history and cutting 8 seconds from his previous WR by doing so
For climbing a whole 60 placements at once and cutting 65 AF with 30 PRs
For getting back on KC's WW tops after so long, with a 5th WW nevertheless
For getting his first WR, on BC3 Shortcut, 3 years after his outrageous choke on that very same category. Emil also was the first to get the shroomless ultra 2/3 in a WR run.
For pulling though with a great PR streak and getting into the Combined Top 10
For FINALLY playing some categories that he wasn't interested in at all like DKS, RR and especially rSL and climbing to #3 in No-Glitch by doing so
For landing the glitch on DKJP and getting his first ever Country Top with it
For reaching the Combined Top 10
For pulling off KC glitch and getting WR as well as being the only karter to land every RTA-viable glitch with it
For getting his first WR (on Grumble Volcano) and being the first person youger than the game to set a WR.
For pulling off the rWS glitch and getting his first WW top
For getting his WR back and subbing 1:40 on rWS Glitch, twice
For improving his RR Glitch WR by pulling it off again... Only 3 attempts after starting his session
For his improvement on his TF WR
For improving his rDKJP No-Glitch WR and getting the last remaining 3lap God standard at the same time
For getting 11 PRs in one week and cutting a great amount of AF for his level
For getting WR on MMM Flap, being the first person to get a God standard on this category in the process
For reaching Top 100
For getting his first WR, on rMC Flap

Dane cut more than 14% of his AF and passed 18 players all in one week
Jon passed 16 players with a 12 point cut, more than anyone else this week.
Dane M has a triumphant week despite his lack of a last name. Scoring 11 PRs and a 20 point AF cut, he was clearly the best of the week.
With 8 PRs, Dane made an impressive ~26.6 point/~17.1% cut and passed 25 players.
Thomas sent in just 2 PRs this week, but it was enough to cut more than 3% from his AF, more than any other player.
In a particularly quiet week, Tim's solid ~2.2 point / ~2.7% AF cut stood out. He moved up 2 places to 50th with only 3 PR's.
A terrific string of a dozen PR's earned Christian this award. He cut ~3.2 points/~3.7% from his AF and moved up one place to 56th.

Even though the other players were quite quiet this week, Thomas kept playing after taking the crown to secure his position, earning 2 more PR's and cutting another ~0.14 points, or ~1.03% from his AF.

With one last strong push, Thomas finally passed Shaun Tanney to become the new site champion. 6 PR's and an impressive ~.8 AF cut helped prove that his lack of SR's didn't mean that he hadn't earned his crown.
Leo had a solid 4 PRs and a 1.4 AF cut in the Top 10, moving from 8th to 7th. His continued activity has been a spark of light in the otherwise mostly dark top group.
A slow week in the Top 100 gave ever-active Christian a chance to shine. With an impressive 8 PR's, he cut ~2.3 points, or ~2.4% of his total AF, and improved from 64th to 62nd.
Rob had one of the most impressive non-hoarded weeks of recent memory. He karted his way to 13 PRs, an 11.6 point AF cut, and a 13 place improvement from 132-> 119.

Rob made an incredible amount of progress for just one week's time, PR'ing 14 times and moving from 146th to 132nd. He slashed almost 22 points, or ~11.1%, from his total AF, much more than anyone in the Top 100.
Daniel clearly took this award, with 4 PRs and an AF cut just over one point. He also moved up a spot from 50th to 49th.
Liam was the only player to exceed a 4% cut in AF this week. 5 solid PR's knocked ~2.36 points off his AF.
Not content to stop at earning the bronze medal, Thomas continued to press on. He earned 5 PR's this week, cutting more than a full point of AF--a rarity at such a high level.

After persistent effort to continue his progress at the top, Thomas was finally rewarded with the #3 spot this week. He cut exactly 1 point of AF--no mean feat at this level--which was just enough to pass Marc Bas.
Large cut from 12 prs, and jumped up roughly 10 places!
Karting 3 solid PRs earned him the coveted award this week.
Reasonable cut in a quiet field.
Great (albeit hoarded) jump into the top 100.
Activity was relatively high this week, but Franco still got the best non-hoarded percentage cut fairly easily, at ~4.6%. 4 PR's knocked 3.25 points off his AF and bumped him up 3 spots to 40th.
Mr. Crutcher's activity crushed all competition this week. An outstanding 13 PR's cut ~9 points and ~9% from his AF, propelling him from #68 to #61.
With even greater progress than last week, Cole outperformed the non-hoarding field again. He cut ~2.45 AF, or ~5.6% of his total, with 8 PR's.
Cole's set of 5 PR's was one of the best earned this week. It netted him a ~1.73 AF cut and bumped him up a spot to 20th.
Alex's push to cut AF paid off this week, earning him a solid 7 PR's. They resulted in a ~2.64 point cut and bumped him up 2 places to 16th.
With his rivalry with Nick Meade reignited, Shaun found motivation to defend his crown this week. 5 PR's cut ~5.22% off his total AF, one of the best non-hoarded percentage cuts of the week.
John wins this one by a landslide. 5 PRs to move from #19 -> #10, as well as a solid 18% AF cut.
Bob's impressive 11 PR string outshone the efforts of higher-ranked karters. He moved up a spot to #44 and cut ~3.3 points, or ~4.38%, from his AF, the best non-hoarded percentage cut of the week.
While other players went off on summer vacations, Daniel kept up his activity with 9 PR's. Cutting ~5 points of AF, his encore performance was enough to earn the award for the second week in a row.

Daniel broke into the Top 100 in style, with an impressive 26 PR's. His ~14.4 AF cut was more than twice as large as his nearest competitors' by both points and percentage, propelling him forward 8 places to 100th on the dot.

There was fierce competition among various top players this week, but Salvatore just barely edges out the others by virtue of more consistent updating. His massive 12 PR load took off ~1.95 points/~4.79% from his AF and bumped him up one spot to #16.
Despite neither earning the most PR's nor improving his rank, Leo had the best non-hoarded AF cut in the Top 100 by a comfortable margin, knocking off ~1.92 points/~4.11% with 5 PR's.
Another quiet week allowed Thomas to double up on POW's with just 4 PR's, cutting just short of a full point of AF and passing Jak Russo for the #8 spot.
With not a soul outside the Top 100 stirring, Thomas cruised to an easy victory this week. His 5 PR's allowed him to overtake Aruba for the #9 spot and earned him a hefty 1.5 AF cut.
With little activity and only a few hoarders as his competition, John stepped up this week. 4 PRs bringing a 1.7 AF cut and a two place improvement, he ran away with the award this week.
Though there was a good bit of activity among the top players, Andre outshined them all. 10 PR's netted him an 8 place improvement and an ~8.67 point/~9.46% AF cut, the best in the Top 100.
Salvatore made a return to MKWii this week, quickly earning 6 PR's and cutting ~1.16 points of AF, enough to bump him up a spot to #20.
With 14 PR's, Leo easily takes this award, jumping forward 7 places to #24 and cutting ~9.83% of his total AF.
Brunn had the best non-hoarded week of all at the top. With 3 PRs, a .34 AF cut, and a one place improvement, he kept playing when others went silent.
Rein hit 2 big PR's this week to simultaneously move up a spot and fend off John Brunn. His AF cut was ~1.45 points, ~3.32% of his total.
With a solid 5 PR's, Leo subbed 60 in AF and cut ~1.77 points of AF, almost half the gap to the karter ahead of him.
With almost no competition, Aruba easily wins this award, moving from #9 - #8 with 2 PR's. He cut ~1.5 points, or about ~5.1% off of his AF.
In a week of overwhelming inactivity, Rein stood head and shoulders above the rest. With 4 PR's, he shaved off 4.375 AF, roughly ~9.18% of his total, and leaped from #23 to #18.
A strong 8 PR week allowed Leo to take this one despite solid competition from the other players. He moved from #44 to #37 and cut ~4.7 points/~6.8% from his AF.
Reinier ran away with the award this week. With just 5 deft PR's, he jumped 9 places to 23rd and cut ~11.1 AF, nearly twice as much as the next biggest cut.
Despite respectable activity from the rest of the field, 3 solid PR's were all it took for Rein to win this award. He moved up 4 spots to 32nd by cutting ~4.17 points of AF, ~6.55% of his total.
Thomas took advantage of a quiet week to break into the Top 10 with 6 PR's. ~2.81 points, or ~8.67% of his total AF, were enough to propel him forward 4 places to #8.
In all the Top 100, no one could keep up with Leo in any category this week. He made the most PR's (15), cut the most AF (9 points, or 10%), and gained the most positions (6 places, to 55th).
Thomas got the biggest cut in the Top 20, with 5 PR's knocking almost 5% off his total, or ~1.83 AF.
Aruba finished the year with a flurry of activity, squeezing in 10 PR's to cut ~5.86% off his AF.
With a solid 5 PR's, Thomas finally made it past an AF gap and gained another place. He cut ~1.56 AF, just over 4% of his total.
For non-hoarded players, John Brunn stood above the rest. His two PRs netted him a 1.34% AF cut, which was better than the other regularly-active players could do.

Although not the highest-ranked player active, Marvin wins the award for being one of only two Top 50 players to gain places and for having the largest non-hoarded percentage cut at ~4.7%. Two Top 10 times among 9 PR's sealed the deal.
With 24 PRs, Dave tore it up this week with a great 12 point AF cut. They may be hoarded, but some Top 10 times combined with minimal activity elsewhere seals the award.
Very low activity at the top let Hoelscher take this. Moving from #90->#82 with 10 PRs, he dropped 10 AF points or 7.9% off of his score.
MG glitchmaster Paul-Philipp showed his full range of skill this week, hitting 12 PRs for a 4.9 AF cut (8.5%), and a 4 place jump in the rankings.
Tandy hit a large 10 PRs this week, prompting a 6.56 AF cut and a 6 place ascention in the charts from 71->65
Alvin Le had a decent 4 PRs, and a move from #18 -> #17 sealed the deal in this quiet week.
Bob Holden's solid week beats everyone else's off week. 5 PRs and a 1.17 AF cut was the best anyone had to offer. Holden takes the POW and moves from #39 -> #38.
Spots #2-4 were all active, but the highest gets the POW. Meade comes back with 7 PRs and a 2.1 point AF cut (15%), to fight off Batten and Tanney. If he hadn't played, both would have passed him.
Jak Russo proves his slot in the Top 10. With 16 PRs an a 24% AF cut (Moving from #10 -> #6), he shut out any competition for the POW.
13 PRs and an 8.64 AF cut determined the score for Dave Tandy, and his jump from #78 -> #72 sealed up this POW.
With a 6.9% AF cut of 3.25 points (highest in the Top 25), Fabien deserves this record. 8 PRs and a jump from #19 -> #17 don't hurt either.
Brunn fights off almost no competition with less than 5 players active. 1 PR for a .68 AF cut was enough to seal it this week.
No one in the Top 50 cut more than 3% off their AF score, so Danny wins with his nice week. Moving from #76 to #72 with 8 PRs and a 3.5 AF cut, he proved he has more to come in the future.
As the activity reaches a low, Cole shines bright in the darkness. His 6 PRs brought a 3.12 AF cut that moved him up from 16th to 14th on the main charts.
Matthias rises up again, this time jumping from #44 to #43. His 4.62% AF cut was the most among Top 50 karters, as he shaved off 3.4 AF with 6 PRs.

Really close this month between Brendan and Shaun who put in a similar amazing effort this month. Shaun edges it by making a huge 75% cut and passing 28 players to finish in 5th.
An easy decision this month. Michael has been far and away the best player, taking a massing 60% off his AF, and adding 5 SRs to his collection  to finish the month in the #2 spot.
Quite close this month (Alvin, Cole, Dave and Omer), Cole wins it with an impressive AF cut (49%) and gaining 7 Site Records.
We only have 3 weeks in this first month, but Giulio put in some great work to reach #1 at the end of April and to win this.

He discovered RR Glitch was possible with Shooting Star, got 3 WRs with it including the first sub 2 minute time on the track, got a handful of other cracked PRs, almost got back to #1 on the site, and even worked on some crazy TASes. Man's done it all.

Over this Quarter, I believe it's safe to say that James is the Karter who has improved the most. He started outside top 300, thinking he could only go as far as Top 250, ye now he's Top 150 and has some Oceanic Tops under his belt. Limits can be pushed.
For establishing himself as a true member of the AF Worldwide Top 10, getting several prestigious PRs and beating the legendary Totom in AF, leaving him at #10
Danny got huge AF cuts this quarter, going from outside of Top 50 to entering the Top 10 in just 3 months
For climbing from #78 to #18 in just 3 months
For his crazy strat implementation
For improving his rank from #100+ to #5
Daseia cut a massive amount of AF this quarter and climbed up quite high on the AF chart
Vincent went from #61 to #28 this quarter, and achieved WW tops on TF sc and regionals on LC along the way.
Luke set 9 WRs total on 4 unique tracks this quarter.
Wilf again was a madman this quarter. He climbed up 33 spots with a 40.5 AF cut and also continued his great work on rDH glitch.
Wilf made the biggest AF cut during this quarter. He cut off 68.4 AF with 31 PR's climbing 66 spots, getting 6th WW on rDH glitch along the way.
Not only did Justin set one WR this quarter, he worked on his timesheet and finally dethroned Fox for site champ on March 24th. This ended Fox’s nearly 4-year reign.
Luke was simply on a tear this quarter. 9 total WRs across 4 different tracks, which included DC, rDS, and ending long reigns on MH and rBC. Luke was a clear winner for this award.
Blaze obtained WW top times on 5 different tracks this quarter, which included 3 WRs on two tracks, those being MMM and rGV2.
David wins the award this quarter for cutting off  41 AF with 33 PRs to pass 28 people. Included in his activity were 4 WW tops times
Zed made a significant jump this quarter, passing 10 players with 27 PRs
Sosis passed 4 players with 9 PRs this quarter, and also improved his own rSL no glitch WR
Fulag passed 5 players this quarter and moved up to #10
Roy passed 7 players with 28 PRs this quarter, and landed himself in the top 10 at #9
Liam only set 6 PRs this quarter, but three of those were WW top times (including an rSGB WR improvement), and he maintained his #10 spot
Steve made it up to #24 by cutting off an impressive 27 AF points this quarter
Thomas cut 3 AF points with 24 PRs this quarter
Luke set 12 PRs and made a 1-point AF cut to maintain his #8 position
Dane passed 15 players with 22 PRs, and moved up to #20
Fox wins POQ for the second time in a row, due to him achieving 17 PRs and becoming the new site champ
Fox obtained 21 PRs and moved into the #2 spot
Luke made a huge jump this quarter, passing 13 players with 47 PRs
Fox submitted 25 PRs during this quarter, which vaulted him up from 9th to 3rd on the AF chart
Paul set 18 PRs this quarter, including a WR on MH
Olifre set 19 PRs this quarter, and got himself into the top 10, at #9
Silver only moved up one spot this quarter, but that was due to a fierce summer PR battle with players such as Salvatore and Leo. Dave managed to stay active throughout however, and set 43 PRs
Dashi improved 27 of his times during the quarter which moved him from #11 to #6
Zoan obtained 20 PRs this quarter and moved from #7 to #6
Thomas started the quarter at #4, but with his steady rate of PRs, he managed to climb to #1 by the end of the year
Dashi set so many PRs this quarter, and moved up a considerable amount, placing him at 16th place on the AF chart

Leo was on fire this quarter, cranking out PR's at an insane rate. In total, he improved 54 of his times; moved from #60 -> #24; and cut nearly 40% off his AF, more than any player above or below him.

Although hoarding often disqualified Dave for smaller awards, the sum of his efforts far exceeded everyone else's this quarter. He improved 53/64 of his times, climbed 31 positions, and cut roughly 34 points and 34% from his AF.
John destroyed this quater. He smashed 45 PRs, jumped all the way from #56 -> #32, and in the process cut 25 points of AF, or 30% of his score. Best of the quarter in all catergories.
Winning the poll amidst controversy (and partial nudity), Shaun was on fire this quarter. His comeback brought him all the way from #7 to #3, without ever slowing down the PR haul.

In a very close POQ race, Chris takes the award. He moved from #218 to #146 throughout the three months, taking a 33% cut to his AF. He also hit 62/64 PRs and PRed on every course in one week during the span. A well deserved award.
Eric had the best quarter out of anyone, without shining in one certain month. #24 --> #17 with a 24% AF cut, coupled with 28 PRs.

Although Nick took the site crown, Jimmy made a greater move. He moved all the way from #20 --> #5 throughout the three months with 59 out of 64 PRs, never slowing down. A 41% AF cut means this was well deserved.

Three were at the top with 30% AF cuts, Tyler McNell, Jimmy Benson and Jason Smith. The award goes to Smith because he took down the most AF overall, passed the most players (#32->#21) and PRed a massive 54 times. The other two were very close runners-up.
James barely beats out Meade by making a huge move from #16 --> #7 in a very short time. He cut 12 points of AF and every player he passed was active, showing how he was just better this quarter.

Never falling victim to the treadmill, Marc took this quarter by steadily improving throughout the 3 months. Starting in 12th and moving into 5th by the end of the quarter came with a 10 point AF cut at a high rank.
It's no surprise who the POQ goes to. David came from nowhere to become Site Champion and leads the way with 10 Site Records to his name.
In the end, there was no competition for this. Nick won November POM and December too. Overall, his 75% cut and 48 place gain was matched by nobody.
In a close poll, Brendan wins out. His 84% AF cut, and his passing of 41 players to finish 3rd along with picking up some site records was enough to convince the voting public and win him the award!

Alvin wins this in a close contest with Michael Fried. Alvin has consistently fought off all-comers and held on to the crown of Site Champion for the last 2 months. Often missing out on weekly and monthly awards, Alvin wins the Quarter!
With 33.3% of the votes, Logan wins his third POTY title.  He hit 24 world records this year and continued his reign as Site Champion.  Arvo and Nara tied for 2nd, gaining 23.3% of the votes each.

With 32.1% of votes, Jack claims it for the first time, and that's deserved. He went from average to one of the best players in the world being World #5, and got his first WRs on rSL Glitch. Justin is 2nd of this poll with 28.6% and Logan 3rd with 21.4%.

With 30/42 votes (71.4%), Logan treats his competition as if it were dust. But this result doesn't surprise anyone... He dominated this year with 30 WRs and took out Justin as the Site Champion. Kasey is 2nd of this poll with 16.6% and Bynt 3rd with 4.7%.

For getting 66% of the popular vote thanks to his WRs on 7 different glitch categories, implementation of incredibly precise strategies and getting to #2 combined and #4 No-SC AF from outside of the top 100 on both.

With 44.6% of the majority vote, Justin wins this award. He was the top all-around player, setting regionals on 47/47 categories while also claiming 8 WRs, mostly notably his 2:17.990 on KC. Justin also took over as site champion and cut his AF down to 6.

Receiving 47/90 votes total from others in the community, Luke wins this award. On sheer quality and quantity of his times, it was easy to recognize Luke’s dominance of the game this year. His 14 total WRs on 6 different courses made him a clear winner.
Blaze achieved 5 WRs, as well as 9 other WW top times. The highlight was taking down Cole's rYF which had lasted over 1,000 days
Fox carries the title for the second year in a row! With 9 impressive WRs and an ongoing #1 rank in the AF chart, Fox wins out against Braixen, Liam, Guy and Havoc.
Luke started the year in 37th, and cut over 40% of his AF, ending the year in 16th, a clear winner for the award.

Thomas won the poll by a landslide, with 68.8% of the votes. He started the year at 13th and steadily worked his way to the top, improving 60 of his times and cutting ~23.6 AF/~63.4% of his AF. He finally took the crown just a week before the year's end.
Shaun continued his domination near the top ranks, moving from #5 to #3 and cutting almost 40% of his AF. He grabbed two SRs throughout the year (KC and rGV2 flap) and PRed on all but three times.

Nick had 75% of the votes for the POY. He finally grabbed the site crown from Bubbles in February and never looked back, holding it for the longest single span (that's still going), since the game's release. He also grabbed numerous SR's along the way.
A clear choice for this award. David joined in January, ousted Alvin for the title two months later, and never looked back, holding the title for the rest of the year and  277/365 days.
Alvin doesn't just win this award, he storms to it. This never looked in any doubt. Lowest AF, Highest Record total, Highest activity, Longest time at #1. Winner by a clear mile.
